definition: the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
cold
surname Leng
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

sentences.english: Never gloat over the ruin of your friend.
sentences.chinese: 不要冷眼旁觀看着你的朋友墮落。

sentences.english: Secular ruined, though I will look on coldly.
sentences.chinese: 世俗的荒涼，我卻冷眼旁觀。

sentences.english: The pace of change is rapid, and you can't sit on the sidelines.
sentences.chinese: 改變的速度飛快，而你不能冷眼旁觀。

sentences.english: Such petty-bourgeois individualists always look coldly from the side-lines at the people's cause.
sentences.chinese: 主義者對人民的事業總是抱着冷眼旁觀的態度。

definition: to have nothing to say (idiom)
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to hate/hatred/to resent/embittered
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to bear grudges
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
features, face (esp. derogatorily)/look/appearance/countenance
to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
